title: UKSA May or May Not Offer £15M for Science Aboard Axiom Mission
summary:
The UK Space Agency announced 20 February that it could make up to £15 million in funding available for science and technology payloads should the country proceed with a proposed Axiom mission. In October 2023, the United Kingdom signed an agreement with the Houston-based private astronaut transportation company Axiom Space. The agreement set out plans […]
The post UKSA May or May Not Offer £15M for Science Aboard Axiom Mission appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: ADRAS-J mission takes methodical first steps towards the commercial removal of space debris
summary: The recent increase in launches to meet growing demands for communications and observation satellites is adding more and more spacecraft to orbit every year. This is especially true in the more congested low-Earth orbit (LEO).

title: UK selects vendors to develop ground systems for military constellation
summary: Lockheed Martin and Rhea Group win $5 million in MoD awards

title: Stormy weather over NOAA’s commitment issues
summary: Industry frustration with the way the U.S. government has been buying commercial weather data rained on NOAA's parade during the American Meteorological Society’s annual meeting in Baltimore.

title: Launch vehicle startup Gilmour Space raises $36 million
summary: The launch vehicle startup plans to manufacture, test and begin launching rockets and satellites from the Bowen Orbital Spaceport in North Queensland.
